intro: Galium album f. pubescens, commonly known as white bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, creeping stems covered in fine, soft hairs, which give it the specific epithet "pubescens." The plant produces small, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy surface. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
